meanings.definition: To strike repeatedly with the fists
meanings.sent1: He pommeled the punching bag in the gym.
meanings.sent2: The boxer pommeled his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to pommel the air, imagining he was a superhero.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain pommeled against the windows all night long.
meanings.sent5: The drummer pommeled the drums with great energy during the concert.

meanings.definition: To beat or strike with a blunt object
meanings.sent1: She pommeled the dough to make it soft for baking.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith pommeled the hot metal on the anvil.
meanings.sent3: The chef pommeled the garlic with a wooden mallet to crush it.
meanings.sent4: The waves pommeled the shore during the storm, eroding the sand.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor pommeled the clay into a beautiful vase shape.

meanings.sent1: The journalist pommeled the corrupt politician in her article.

meanings.sent3: The comedian pommeled the audience with jokes all night.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter weather pommeled the crops, causing damage.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher pommeled the students with homework assignments.
